intro: Memecylon subfurfuraceum var. depauperatum, commonly known as the slender memecylon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is characterized by its small, elongated leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky pubescence. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. This variety is distinguished by its reduced floral structures and overall smaller size compared to other members of the species.
